hospitals.name: Baylor Scott & White Medical Center - Lakeway

courts.typical_timeline: Personal injury cases in Travis County typically take 12-24 months from filing to trial, though complex cases may take longer.

dangerous_roads.name: Interstate 35 (I-35)
dangerous_roads.description: Texas's deadliest interstate runs through downtown Austin. The stretch between US-290 and SH-71 sees over 100 crashes annually due to heavy congestion and construction.

dangerous_roads.name: MoPac Expressway (Loop 1)
dangerous_roads.description: High-speed commuter corridor with frequent rear-end collisions during rush hour. The toll lanes create dangerous merge points.

dangerous_roads.name: US Highway 183
dangerous_roads.description: Major north-south artery connecting Cedar Park to Austin-Bergstrom Airport. High crash rates near shopping centers and interchanges.

dangerous_roads.name: US Highway 290 East
dangerous_roads.description: Growing corridor to Manor and Elgin sees increasing accidents as development outpaces road improvements.

dangerous_roads.name: State Highway 71
dangerous_roads.description: High-speed highway to Austin-Bergstrom Airport with fatal crashes at major intersections.

dangerous_roads.name: FM 2222 (Koenig Lane/Bull Creek Road)
dangerous_roads.description: Winding hill country road notorious for motorcycle accidents and head-on collisions.

dangerous_roads.name: Ben White Boulevard (SH-71)
dangerous_roads.description: Major east-west corridor with high-speed crashes, especially near I-35 and South Lamar intersections.

dangerous_intersections: Lamar Boulevard and Ben White Boulevard
austin.local_context: As Texas's state capital and a rapidly growing tech hub, Austin sees increasing traffic congestion and accident rates. The city's population has doubled in the past two decades, but road infrastructure hasn't kept pace.

houston.name: Houston

courts.typical_timeline: Personal injury cases in Harris County typically take 18-30 months from filing to trial due to heavy docket volume.

dangerous_roads.name: Interstate 45 (Gulf Freeway)
dangerous_roads.description: Consistently ranked among the deadliest highways in America. The stretch from downtown to Galveston sees hundreds of fatal crashes annually.

dangerous_roads.name: Interstate 10 (Katy Freeway)
dangerous_roads.description: One of the widest freeways in the world still experiences massive congestion and high-speed crashes.

dangerous_roads.name: US Highway 59/I-69 (Southwest Freeway)
dangerous_roads.description: Major corridor through affluent southwest Houston with frequent accidents during rush hours.

dangerous_roads.name: Beltway 8 (Sam Houston Tollway)
dangerous_roads.description: High-speed toll road circling Houston sees numerous crashes, especially at major freeway interchanges.

dangerous_roads.name: Loop 610
dangerous_roads.description: Inner loop highway with dangerous curves and outdated design causing frequent accidents.

dangerous_roads.name: US Highway 290 (Northwest Freeway)
dangerous_roads.description: Fast-growing corridor to northwest suburbs experiences increasing accident rates.

houston.local_context: As America's fourth-largest city and home to the Texas Medical Center, Houston handles more trauma cases than almost any city in Texas. The sprawling metropolitan area and complex freeway system contribute to high accident rates.

dangerous_roads.name: US Highway 75 (Central Expressway)

dangerous_roads.name: Interstate 20

dallas.local_context: Dallas is a major business hub with one of America's busiest airport systems. The complex highway interchange system, particularly the I-35E/I-30 'Mixmaster,' creates dangerous conditions for drivers unfamiliar with the area.

crash_stats.top_cause: Distracted driving and failure to yield

san-antonio.local_context: San Antonio is Texas's second-largest city and home to multiple military bases. The combination of tourism (Alamo, River Walk), military presence, and rapid suburban growth creates unique traffic challenges.

rio-grande-valley.local_context: The Rio Grande Valley is one of the fastest-growing regions in Texas with unique challenges including international border traffic, agricultural vehicles, and dense urban areas. Heavy truck traffic from international trade contributes to serious accidents.

courts.typical_timeline: Personal injury cases in West Texas typically take 10-18 months from filing to trial, often faster than urban courts.

dangerous_roads.description: Main east-west corridor through the Permian Basin carries heavy oilfield traffic and sees frequent fatal crashes.

dangerous_roads.name: Interstate 10 (Far West Texas)
dangerous_roads.description: Long stretches with limited services lead to fatigued drivers and high-speed crashes.

west-texas.local_context: West Texas is the heart of the Permian Basin oil industry. The region sees extremely heavy commercial truck traffic, oilfield equipment transport, and fatigued workers commuting long distances. This creates uniquely dangerous driving conditions.

crash_stats.top_cause: Commercial vehicle crashes and fatigued driving
